articles.headline: German at European Central Bank at Odds With Country’s Policy Makers
articles.snippet: The top German official at the European Central Bank defended its plans to intervene in bond markets as a way of lowering borrowing costs for business.
articles.abstract: The top German official at the European Central Bank defended its plans to intervene in bond markets as a way of lowering borrowing costs for business.
articles.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT — A top German official at the European Central Bank on Monday defended the bank’s plans to intervene in bond markets to push down borrowing costs for businesses and encourage economic growth. The position puts him at odds with the president of Germany’s central bank and highlights a growing split in the country’s policy-making elite.
articles.byline: By Jack Ewing and Melissa Eddy

articles.headline: Deal Helps a Bank Catch Up in Capital
articles.snippet: The acquisition of Hudson City Bancorp sheds light on M&T Bank’s effort to bring its capital levels closer to the standards favored by regulators.
articles.abstract: The acquisition of Hudson City Bancorp sheds light on M&T Bank’s effort to bring its capital levels closer to the standards favored by regulators.
articles.lead_paragraph: One of the nation’s bigger regional banks, M&T Bank, has had a hectic few days of deal-making.

articles.headline: Gangs’ Truce Buys El Salvador a Tenuous Peace
articles.snippet: A truce between two notoriously violent street gangs endures in El Salvador after five months, but some wonder whether the government has made a deal with the devil.
articles.abstract: A truce between two notoriously violent street gangs endures in El Salvador after five months, but some wonder whether the government has made a deal with the devil.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN SALVADOR — They had faced off many times before, on the streets, with guns in their hands. But when top leaders of two of the hemisphere’s most violent street gangs sat across from one another in the stifling air of a maximum security prison here this year, the encounter had a very different aim: peace.

articles.headline: Samsung Case Puts Apple Closer to Google Fight
articles.snippet: By making its own hardware, Google could end up more squarely in Apple’s sights. The jury’s findings in the case could potentially force Google to adjust its software, too.
articles.abstract: By making its own hardware, Google could end up more squarely in Apple’s sights. The jury’s findings in the case could potentially force Google to adjust its software, too.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Steven P. Jobs minced no words when talking about Android, Google’s mobile operating system, which he saw as too similar to the iPhone’s. He told his biographer, Walter Isaacson, that Android was “a stolen product” and said, “I’m willing to go thermonuclear war on this.”
articles.byline: By Claire Cain Miller and Brian X. Chen

articles.headline: Active in Cloud, Amazon Reshapes Computing
articles.snippet: Amazon is quietly upending the world of business computing through its cloud operations, a vast resource that gives companies heavy computing power without the baseline costs.
articles.abstract: Amazon is quietly upending the world of business computing through its cloud operations, a vast resource that gives companies heavy computing power without the baseline costs.
articles.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — Within a few years, Amazon.com’s creative destruction of both traditional book publishing and retailing may be footnotes to the company’s larger and more secretive goal: giving anyone on the planet access to an almost unimaginable amount of computing power.

articles.headline: Business and Political Experiences Pull Romney 2 Ways on Economy
articles.snippet: As governor of Massachusetts, Mitt Romney supported a greater government role in the economy, but as a presidential candidate, he has moved closer to the Republican mainstream.
articles.abstract: As governor of Massachusetts, Mitt Romney supported a greater government role in the economy, but as a presidential candidate, he has moved closer to the Republican mainstream.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When Mitt Romney declared during his unsuccessful campaign for the Senate in 1994 that the federal minimum wage should rise with inflation, a break with Republican doctrine, both Democrats and Republicans accused him of pandering to Massachusetts voters.

articles.headline: Military Spending on Biofuels Draws Fire
articles.snippet: The cost of biofuels in Defense Department trials has made them a flash point in the debate over government financing for new energy technologies.
articles.abstract: The cost of biofuels in Defense Department trials has made them a flash point in the debate over government financing for new energy technologies.
articles.lead_paragraph: When the Navy put a Pacific fleet through maneuvers on a $12 million cocktail of biofuels this summer, it proved that warships could actually operate on diesel from algae or chicken fat.

articles.headline: I.B.M. Mainframe Evolves to Serve the Digital World
articles.snippet: Executives said the company’s new line of mainframe computers can tackle any trend in corporate computing, from the cloud to so-called green computing.
articles.abstract: Executives said the company’s new line of mainframe computers can tackle any trend in corporate computing, from the cloud to so-called green computing.
articles.lead_paragraph: I.B.M. is introducing on Tuesday a new line of mainframe computers, adding yet another chapter to a remarkable story of technological longevity and business strategy.

articles.headline: Hurricane Isaac Makes Landfall Along Gulf Coast
articles.snippet: The storm hit southeastern Louisiana on Tuesday night as a Category 1 hurricane, with sustained winds of 80 miles per hour.
articles.abstract: The storm hit southeastern Louisiana on Tuesday night as a Category 1 hurricane, with sustained winds of 80 miles per hour.
articles.lead_paragraph: NEW ORLEANS — On the eve of the seventh anniversary of Hurricane Katrina, which brought widespread devastation after the colossal failure of the system built to protect the city, New Orleans on Tuesday night once again found itself facing the impending arrival of a huge and deadly storm.
articles.byline: By John Schwartz and Campbell Robertson

articles.headline: Hard-Hit Cities Show a Housing Rebound
articles.snippet: The latest housing data showed a year-over-year increase in prices nationally, with a recovery apparent even in places like Miami, Atlanta and Detroit.
articles.abstract: The latest housing data showed a year-over-year increase in prices nationally, with a recovery apparent even in places like Miami, Atlanta and Detroit.
articles.lead_paragraph: Even some of the cities that suffered the most in the housing bust are showing signs of improvement, with prices beginning to recover in places like Miami, Atlanta and Detroit, according to the latest housing data.
